publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: As I strole ye City oft I
See a Building large & lofty
Not a Bow shot from ye College
Half ye Globe from Sence & Knowledge
By ye prudent Architect
Placed against ye Church direct
Making good my Granums jest
Near ye Church────you know ye rest.Tell us what ye Pile contains,
Many a head that holds no Brains.
These Demoniacks let me Dub
With ye name of Legion Club.
Such Assemblys you might swear
Meet when Butchers Baite a Bear.
Such a Noise & such haranguing
When a Brother Thief's a hanging.
Such a rout & such a Rabble
Run to hear Jack Puding Babble.
Such a Crowd their Ordure throws
On a far less Villains Nose.
Could I from ye Building top
Hear ye ratling Thunder drop,
while ye Devil upon ye Roof
(If ye Devil be Thunder proof)
Shoud with Poker fiery red
Crack ye Stones & melt ye Lead
Drive 'em down on ev'ry Skull
When ye Den of Thieves is full
Quite destroy ye Harpys Nest
How might then our Isle be blest.
For Divines allow that God
Sometimes makes ye Devil his Rod,
And ye Gospel will inform us
He can punish Sins enormous.
Yet shoud Swift endow ye Schools
For his Lunaticks & Fools
With a Rood or two of Land
I allow ye Pile may stand
You perhaps will ask me why so
But it is with this Proviso
Since ye House is like to last
Let a Royal Grant be past
That ye Club have right to dwell
Each within his propper Cell
With a passage left to creep in
And a hole above for peeping
Let them when they once get in
Sell ye Nation for a Pin
While they Sit a picking Straws
Let them rave of making Laws
While they never hold their Tongue
Let them dabble in their Dung
Let them form a Grand Committee
How to Plague & starve ye City
Let them Storm & Stare & frown
When they see a Clergy Gown
Let them 'ere they crack a Louse
Call for th'orders of ye House
Let them with their Goslin Quills
Scrible Senceless Heads of Bills
We may while they strain their Throats
Wipe our Arses with their Votes
Let Sr Tom 1Sṛ Thomas Prendergast that rampant Ass
Stuff his Guts with Flax & Grass
But before ye Priest he Fleeces
Tear ye Bible all to pieces.
At ye Parson Tom, halloo boy
Worthy Offspring of a Shoeboy
Footman Traytor vile Seducer
Perjur'd Rebel, Brib'd Accuser
Lay thy paultry Privledge aside
Sprung from Papist & Regicide
Fall a working like a Mole
Raise ye Dirt about thy holeCome assist me Muse obedient
Let us try some new expedient
Shift ye Scene for half an hour
Time & Place are in thy power
Thither gentle Muse conduct me
I shall ask & you instruct me
See ye Muse unbarrs ye Gate
Hark ye Monkeys how they prate
All ye Gods who rule ye Soul
Styx thro Hell whose Waters rowl
Let me be allow'd to tell
What I heard in yonder CellNear ye Door an entrance gapes
Crowded round with Antick Shapes
Poverty & Grief & care
Causeless joy & true despair
Discord perriwig'd with Snakes
See ye dreadfull stride she takes
By this odious Crew beset
I began to Rage & fret
And resolv'd to break their Pates
E're we enter'd at ye Gates
Had not Clio in ye nick
Whisper'd me Let fall your Stick
What said I, is this the Mad house
These she answerd are but Shadows
Phantoms Bodiless & vain
Empty Visions of ye Brain
In ye Porch Briareus stands
Shews a Bribe in all his hands
Briareus ye Secretary
But we Mortalls call him Cary
When ye Rogues their Country Fleece
They may hope for pence apieceClio Who had been so wise
To put on a Fools disguise
To bespeak some approbation
And be thought a near RelationWhen she saw 200 Brutes
All involv'd in wild disputes
Roaring till their Tongues were spent
Priviledge of Parliament
Now a new misfortune feels
Dreading to be laid by th'heels
Never durst a Muse before
Enter that infernal DoorClio stiffled with ye smell
Into Spleen & Vapours fell
By the Stygian Steams that flew
From ye dire infectious Crew
Not ye Stench of Lake Avernus
Cou'd have more offended her Nose
Had she flown but ore the top
She must feel her Pinions drop
And by exhalations dire
Tho a Goddess must expire
In a fright she crept away
Bravely I resolv'd to stay
When I saw ye Keeper frown
Tiping him with half a Crown
Now said I we are alone
Name your Heros one by one
Who is that Hell featur'd Bawler
Is it Satan?──no tis Waller
In what figure can a Bard dress
Iack ye Grandson of Sr. Hardress
Honest Keeper drive him further
In his Looks are Hell & Murder
See his Scowling Visage drop
Iust as when he Murderd ThropKeeper shew me where to fix
On the Puppy pair of Dicks2Dick Tigh & Dick Bettesworth
By their Lanthorn Jaws & Leathern
You may swear they both are Brethren3Dick Tigh Dick Fitz-Baker Dick ye Player.
Old acquaintance are you there?
Dear Companions hug & kiss
Toast old Glorious in your Piss
Tye them Keeper in a Tether
Let them Starve & stink together
Both are apt to be unruly
Lash 'em daily, Lash em duely
Tho 'tis hopeless to reclaim 'em
Scorpion Rods perhaps may tame 'em
Keeper yon old Dotard smoke
Sweetly snoaring in his Cloak
Who is he?──'tis hum drum Wynn4Genl Wynn
Half encompassd with his KinThere observe the Tribe of Bingham
For he never fails to bring 'em
And ye base Apostate Vesey
With Bishops Scraps grown Fat & greasy
While he Sleeps ye whole Debate
They submissive round him wait
(Yet wou'd gladly see ye Hunks
In his Grave & search his Trunks)
See they gently pull his Coat
Just to yawn & give his VoteThose are Allens Jack & Bob
First in ev'ry wicked Job
Son & Brother to a queer
Brainsick Brute they call a Peer
We must give them better quarter
For their Ancestor trod Mortar
And at Hoath to boast his Fame
On a Chimney cut his NameThere sit Clements Dilks & Carter
Who for Hell wou'd die a Martyr
Such a Triplet coud you tell
Where to find on this side Hell
Gallows Carter Dilks & Clements
Sowse 'em in their own Excrements
Ev'ry Mischief's in their hearts
If they fail 'tis want of parts.Bless us 5Mark Antony MorganMorgan art thou there man
Bless mine Eyes art thou the Chair-man
Chair-man to yon damn'd Committee
Yet I look on thee with pitty
Dreadfull sight! what Learned Morgan
Metamorphos'd to a Gorgon
For thy horrid looks I own
Half convert me to a Stone
Hast thou been so long at School
Now to turn a Factious Fool
Alma Mater was thy Mother
Ev'ry young Divine thy Brother
Thou a disobedient Varlet
Treats thy Mother like a Harlot
Thou ungratefull to thy Teachers
Who are grown Rev'rend PreachersMorgan woud it not surprise one
Turn thy Nourishment to Poison
When you walk among your Books
They reproach you with their looks
Bind them fast or from yṛ Shelves
They'l fly down to right themselvesHomer Plutarch Virgil Flaccus
All in Arms prepare to back us
Soon repent or put to Slaughter
Ev'ry Greek & Roman Author
Will you in your factious phrase
Send ye Clergy all to Grase
And to make your Project pass
Leave 'em not a Blade of Grass
How I want thee hum'rous Hogarth!
Thou I hear a pleasant Rogue art
Were but you & I acquainted
Ev'ry Monster shou'd be Painted
You shoud try your Graving Tools
On this odious Groop of Fools
Draw ye Beasts as I describe them
Form their Features while I jibe 'em
Draw 'em like for I assure you
They need no Caricatura
Draw 'em so that we may trace
All the Soul in ev'ry faceKeeper I must now retire
You have done what I desire
But I feel my Spirits spent
With ye Noise, ye sight ye Scent.Pray be patient you shall find
Half ye best are still behind
You have hardly seen a Score
I can shew 200 moreKeeper I have seen enough
Taking then a Pinch of Snuff
I concluded looking round 'em
May their God, the Devil confound 'em.829-680B
